title.narrative: Provision of shelter assistance and emergency NFI kits to people in need

description.narrative:
Based on comprehensive needs assessment and analysis of the humanitarian situation in Syria carried out by the inter-sector group, which indicated that Rural Damascus, Dar’a and Latakia Governorates have the highest shelter needs, UNHCR and partners are repairing 500 damaged shelters in these governorates to provide adequate and safe shelter support to some 2,500 directly affected people, in line with the 2022 Shelter Sector priorities. Through this project, UNHCR aims to strengthen resilience and humanitarian early recovery in areas with the greatest needs, including areas where returns have recently taken place.
In north-west Syria UNHCR delivers humanitarian assistance within the framework of the HRP for Syria and under the authority of UN Security Council Resolution 2165 (2014) authorizing cross-border humanitarian operations. Through this project, UNHCR purchases, transports and distributes emergency NFI kits to IDPs in sub-districts hosting the largest numbers of displaced people (access permitting), directly benefiting some 45,000 people through 9,000 kits, in coordination with the SNFI Cluster.
This project targets a grand total of 47.500 affected people.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Provision of shelter assistance and emergency NFI kits to people in need

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
